gt_description: Replacing .orElseThrow() with .get() in AddressServiceImpl.getById() causes an unhandled NoSuchElementException and returns HTTP 500 instead of the proper HTTP 404 whenever a client requests a non-existent address ID
det_description: Direct use of Optional.get() without isPresent() check on addressRepository.findById(addressId) can cause NoSuchElementException if address not found. This is a nonmalicious development fault (omission: missing error handling).

gt_description: Missing save call in the repository/data access layer
det_description: Address entity is created from AddressRequest and User, but not persisted (missing addressRepository.save(addressEntity)), so returned AddressResponse may have null id and address is not stored. Nonmalicious development fault (omission: missing persistence).

gt_description: Username parameter is concatenated directly into SQL, allowing an attacker to retrieve data via SQL injections
det_description: SQL injection vulnerability: username is concatenated directly into SQL string in getByUsername. Nonmalicious development fault (injection: unsafe query construction).

gt_description: Calling .get() on findByUsername() causes a NoSuchElementException (HTTP 500) on every login attempt with a non-existent username instead of returning the intended HTTP 401 Unauthorized
det_description: Direct use of Optional.get() without isPresent() check on userRepository.findByUsername(username) can cause NoSuchElementException if user not found. Nonmalicious development fault (omission: missing error handling).

gt_description: Logs include user passwords in plaintext, potentially exposing them in logs accessible to operators or attackers
det_description: Sensitive information leak: logs user password in plaintext in save(). Nonmalicious development fault (commission: logging secrets).

gt_description: PasswordEncoder created per request rather than as a singleton
det_description: Inconsistent password hashing: uses new BCryptPasswordEncoder() for save/update, but injected passwordEncoder elsewhere. May cause login failures if encoders differ. Nonmalicious development fault (design inconsistency).

gt_description: Missing delete call in the repository/data access layer
det_description: User entity is not deleted from repository in delete(); only logs deletion. Nonmalicious development fault (omission: missing repository.delete call).

gt_description: Double encryption of the password using a password encoder
det_description: Password is double-encoded in updateUserEntityFromUserRequest: passwordEncoder.encode(passwordEncoder.encode(dto.password())). Nonmalicious development fault (logic error: double hashing).

gt_description: Hardcoded Linux-specific log directory. Running this on Windows or another OS will fail or move to an unpredictable location unless manually changed
det_description: Default log file name contains colon (application:errors.log), which is invalid on Windows and some filesystems. Nonmalicious development fault (configuration portability).

gt_description: Loading all users before pagination and transform them to DTOs â€“ wrong order
det_description: Pagination is implemented in-memory after fetching all users, which may cause performance issues for large datasets. Nonmalicious development fault (inefficient implementation).

gt_description: PasswordEncoder created per request rather than as a singleton
det_description: In update, uses new BCryptPasswordEncoder() instead of injected passwordEncoder, causing inconsistency with login and other flows. Nonmalicious development fault (design inconsistency).
